examples.sentence: Physical movement towards the speaker while doing an action
Change that has occurred up to the present
Something beginning to happen or approaching
〜てくる vs 〜ていく - Directional comparison

sections.heading: What is 〜てくる (te-kuru)?
sections.content:
〜てくる combines the te-form with くる (to come) and expresses:

Physical movement towards the speaker while doing an action Change that has occurred up to the present Something beginning to happen or approaching

[Verb te-form] + くる 持ってくる "bring (here)" 寒くなってくる "has become cold / is getting cold"

children.heading: Basic Pattern
children.content: Verb (te-form) + くる Plain: 〜てくる Polite: 〜てきます 持ってくる / 持ってきます "bring (here)" 変わってくる / 変わってきます "has changed / is changing"

children.heading: 1. Physical Movement Towards
children.content:
Doing an action while coming towards the speaker.

持ってくる "bring (something here)" 連れてくる "bring (someone here)" 運んでくる "carry (here)" 送ってくる "send (to here)"

children.heading: 2. Change Up to Present
children.content:
Change that has occurred from the past until now.

寒くなってきた "has gotten cold / is getting cold" わかってきた "am starting to understand" 慣れてきた "have gotten used to" 疲れてきた "am getting tired"

children.heading: 3. Beginning/Approaching
children.content:
Something starting to happen or coming near.

雨が降ってきた "it started raining" 春が来る "spring is coming" 暗くなってきた "it's getting dark"

children.heading: Bringing Things
children.content: お弁当を持ってくる "bring a lunch box" 本を持ってきた "brought a book" 荷物を運んでくる "carry luggage here"

children.heading: Bringing People
children.content: 友達を連れてくる "bring a friend" 子供を連れてきた "brought a child"

children.heading: Versus ていく (Direction)
children.content: てくる: Toward speaker 持ってくる - "bring (here)" ていく: Away from speaker 持っていく - "take (away)"

children.heading: Recent Changes
children.content: 寒くなってきた "it's gotten cold" 暗くなってきた "it's gotten dark" わかってきた "I'm starting to understand" 慣れてきた "I've gotten used to it"

children.heading: Progressive Understanding
children.content: 意味がわかってきた "the meaning is becoming clear" 日本語ができてきた "my Japanese is improving" 上手になってきた "I'm getting better"

children.heading: Physical/Emotional Changes
children.content: 疲れてきた "I'm getting tired" 眠くなってきた "I'm getting sleepy" お腹が空いてきた "I'm getting hungry" 楽しくなってきた "it's becoming fun"

children.heading: Weather Changes
children.content: 雨が降ってきた "it started raining" 雪が降ってきた "it started snowing" 風が吹いてきた "wind started blowing"

children.heading: Natural Phenomena
children.content: 暗くなってきた "it's getting dark" 明るくなってきた "it's getting light" 暖かくなってきた "it's getting warm"

children.heading: Events Beginning
children.content: 音楽が聞こえてきた "music started to be heard" 人が集まってきた "people started gathering"

children.heading: 最近 (recently)
children.content: 最近寒くなってきた "it's gotten cold recently" 最近忙しくなってきた "I've gotten busy recently"

children.heading: だんだん (gradually)
children.content: だんだんわかってきた "I'm gradually understanding" だんだん慣れてきた "I'm gradually getting used to it"

children.heading: 少しずつ (little by little)
children.content: 少しずつできてきた "I can do it little by little" 少しずつ良くなってきた "it's getting better little by little"

sections.heading: Comparison: てくる vs ていく

children.heading: てくる (Towards/Up to Now)
children.content: Physical: 持ってくる "bring (here)" Change: 寒くなってきた "has gotten cold (up to now)" Beginning: 雨が降ってきた "it started raining"

children.heading: ていく (Away/From Now On)
children.content: Physical: 持っていく "take (away)" Change: 寒くなっていく "will get colder (going forward)" Future: 頑張っていく "will work hard (from now)"

children.heading: Key Difference
children.content: てくる: Focus on change up to present ていく: Focus on future progression

children.heading: Movement
children.content: 持ってくる - bring 連れてくる - bring (person) 運んでくる - carry here 帰ってくる - come back

children.heading: Change/Beginning
children.content: なってくる - become わかってくる - start to understand できてくる - become able to 見えてくる - come into view 聞こえてくる - become audible

children.heading: Development
children.content: 慣れてくる - get used to 疲れてくる - get tired 飽きてくる - get bored 覚えてくる - start remembering

children.heading: 〜てこない
children.content: 持ってこない "won't bring" わかってこない "don't start understanding" 慣れてこない "don't get used to"

children.heading: 〜てきた
children.content:
Often emphasizes completion of gradual change.

やっとわかってきた "finally started understanding" だんだん慣れてきた "gradually got used to it" 寒くなってきた "got cold"

children.heading: Example 1: Bringing Something
children.content: A: 明日何を持ってくる？ "What will you bring tomorrow?" B: お弁当を持ってきます "I'll bring lunch" A: 飲み物は？ "What about drinks?" B: それも持ってくるよ "I'll bring that too"

children.heading: Example 2: Noticing Change
children.content: A: 寒いね "It's cold" B: うん、最近寒くなってきたね "Yeah, it's gotten cold recently" A: もう冬だね "It's already winter"

children.heading: Example 3: Progress
children.content: A: 日本語、どう？ "How's your Japanese?" B: 少しずつわかってきた "I'm starting to understand little by little" A: 頑張ってるね "You're working hard" B: ありがとう。最近楽しくなってきた "Thanks. It's become fun recently"

children.heading: Example 4: Sudden Change
children.content: A: あ、雨だ "Oh, rain" B: 急に降ってきたね "It suddenly started raining" A: 傘ある？ "Do you have an umbrella?"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Wrong direction
children.content: Context: Someone bringing something to you Wrong: 持っていく ❌ Right: 持ってくる ✓ "bring (here)"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using for future changes
children.content: Context: Will get cold from now Less natural: 寒くなってくる ⚠️ More natural: 寒くなっていく ✓ "will get cold" Note: てくる focuses on changes up to now

children.heading: Mistake 3: Confusing with simple past
children.content: 寒くなった - "got cold" (simple past) 寒くなってきた - "has gotten cold / is getting cold" (gradual/recent)

children.heading: Gradual Realization
children.content: わかってきた "I'm starting to understand" (gradual process) vs. わかった "I understood" (sudden realization)

children.heading: Recent Change
children.content: 忙しくなってきた "I've gotten busy (recently)" vs. 忙しくなった "I got busy" (neutral past)

children.heading: やっと〜てきた (finally)
children.content: やっとわかってきた "finally starting to understand" やっと慣れてきた "finally getting used to it"

children.heading: 急に〜てきた (suddenly)
children.content: 急に雨が降ってきた "it suddenly started raining" 急に寒くなってきた "it suddenly got cold"

children.heading: 〜てきたところ (just came)
children.content: 今帰ってきたところです "I just came back" 買ってきたところ "just bought and brought it"

children.heading: I-adjectives
children.content: 寒くなってきた "has gotten cold" 難しくなってきた "has gotten difficult" 良くなってきた "has gotten better" 暗くなってきた "has gotten dark"

children.heading: Na-adjectives
children.content: 便利になってきた "has become convenient" 有名になってきた "has become famous" 元気になってきた "has become energetic"

children.heading: Physical Sensations
children.content: 疲れてきた "I'm getting tired" 眠くなってきた "I'm getting sleepy" お腹が空いてきた "I'm getting hungry" のどが渇いてきた "I'm getting thirsty"

children.heading: Emotional Changes
children.content: 楽しくなってきた "it's becoming fun" つまらなくなってきた "it's becoming boring" 心配になってきた "I'm getting worried"

children.heading: Seasons Approaching
children.content: 春になってきた "spring is coming" 暖かくなってきた "it's getting warm" 涼しくなってきた "it's getting cool"

children.heading: Time of Day
children.content: 明るくなってきた "it's getting light" 暗くなってきた "it's getting dark" 遅くなってきた "it's getting late"

children.heading: Casual
children.content: 持ってくる "I'll bring it" わかってきた "I'm starting to understand"

children.heading: Polite
children.content: 持ってきます "I'll bring it" わかってきました "I've started to understand"

children.heading: Physical Movement
children.content: 本を図書館から持ってくる "bring a book from the library" 友達を家に連れてくる "bring a friend to my house" 荷物を運んでくる "carry luggage here" 明日持ってきます "I'll bring it tomorrow"

children.heading: Change Up to Present
children.content: 最近寒くなってきた "it's gotten cold recently" 日本語がわかってきた "I'm starting to understand Japanese" だんだん慣れてきた "I've gradually gotten used to it" 疲れてきた "I'm getting tired"

children.heading: Beginning Actions
children.content: 雨が降ってきた "it started raining" 暗くなってきた "it's getting dark" 音が聞こえてきた "sound started to be heard" 人が集まってきた "people started gathering"

children.heading: Realization/Understanding
children.content: やっとわかってきた "finally starting to understand" 意味が見えてきた "the meaning is becoming clear" できてきた "I'm becoming able to do it"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: 〜ていく (te-iku) - Motion away/future progression Te-form Conjugation - Basic te-form 〜てくる vs 〜ていく - Directional comparison Change & Transformation - Expressing change 〜始める (hajimeru) - Start doing Present Tense Usage - Current states
